title: TTV Tools — Settings

auto-join: When presented with a warning that the stream is intended for
away-mode:schedule:create:notice: Times will be saved in your current timezone
first-in-line: When a channel goes live, head to its stream automatically
adds a queueing service to Twitch™
first-in-line:notification: When you receive a notification for a channel going live, go to its stream after
first-in-line:appearance: When a channel appears in your Followed Channels, go to its stream after
first-in-line:smart-notifications: Go to all streams automatically after
up-next:extras: Only the first tab to load
auto-follow: While watching a channel that isn't followed, follow it automatically
auto-follow:raids: When participating in a raid, follow the channel being raided
kill-extensions: Do not allow Twitch™ extensions to display over the stream
next-channel-preference: How should the next channel be chosen when
This only activates when the current stream goes offline
next-channel-preference:options: Go with the least channel points
Go with the most channel points
Go with the closest to having all channel point rewards
Go with the furthest from having all channel point rewards
prevent-hosting: Prevent certain or all channels from hosting by going to the
prevent-hosting:options: Prevent unfollowed channels from being hosted
prevent-raiding: Prevent certain or all channels from raiding by going to the
prevent-raiding:options: Only raid to collect channel points
Prevent unfollowed channels from being raided
stay-live: After the current stream ends, go to the
view-mode: When the page is done loading, change the view to
bttv-emotes: This may cause instability while loading emotes
filter-messages:bullets-options: Hide all channel point related bulletins
highlight-mentions: ), make the message stand out by highlighting it
highlight-mentions:options: When someone sends a general mention (
), make the message stand out by highlighting it
highlight-phrases: When someone sends a message using any of the following phrases, make the message stand out by highlighting it
native-reply: Attempt to display native Twitch™ replies on all channels
notification-sounds: When one (or more) of the following conditions are met, play a notification sound
notification-sounds:include-phrases: When someone is using a phrase from
notification-sounds:include-whispers: When someone sends you a whisper, play the
prevent-spam:options: will ignore messages if there aren't any words longer than
recover-chat: is not loaded (or suddenly destroyed), attempt to recover it
highlight-mentions-popup: ), make the message stand out by showing a pop-up
simplify-chat: Apply dual tones to make chat easier to read
simplify-chat:options: Display chat in the following font
Convert emotes back into their text, and display the emote (as a
rewards-calculator: Estimates how long a stream needs to be watched to redeem
accent-color: What should the accent color be
stream-preview: Display a live preview of streams when hovering over them
stream-preview:size: Adjust the size of the preview
stream-preview:sound: Adjust the sound of the preview
keep-popout: When moving to another page, prevent the extension from destroying the small video (pop-out) of the stream
recover-ads: When an advertisement fails to play ("freezes"), attempt to recover it
recover-frames: When the video fails to play (drops frames for longer than
recover-pages: If the webpage fails to display, attempt to recover it
recover-stream: When the stream fails to play ("freezes"), attempt to recover it
recover-video: When the video fails to download (black screen), reload the webpage
@console: Allow the extension to display messages in the console
@stats: Allow the extension to display statistics
@experimental: Allow the extension to display, and use experimental features
@fine-details: Allow the extension to use Twitch™ API data to enhance your experience
This will not collect any data. It will use the data Twitch™ has collected
@@auto-focus:options:detection-level: Low activity — Just Chatting / Simulation / Strategy
@@auto-focus:options:polling-interval: How often should the stream be
Every second — CPU intensive, great detection
Every 3 seconds — CPU friendly, good detection
Every 5 seconds — CPU friendly, fair detection
Every 10 seconds — CPU friendly, poor detection
@@auto-focus:options:image-type: What image type should be used for
@@convert-emotes: When presented with Twitch™ emotes, collect them for usage (without requiring a subscription)
This only works for the current stream you are viewing
@@predictive-raiding: This takes at least one week to properly adjust
@@soft-unban: Re-enable chat for channels you've been banned from
This only allows viewing the chat
